channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Two Auckland clinics closed after visits from positive cases
item.description: Ōtāhuhu Health Centre in South Auckland and Westview Medical Centre in the west have been temporarily closed after two positive cases visited.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 12 August
item.description: Police checkpoints were set up around Auckland's borders, people rushed to the supermarkets to stock up and testing centres boosted capacity.

item.title: Mortgage deferral scheme to be extended
item.description: The scheme was set up in March for six months when the first lockdown came into effect. The Reserve Bank says it will further be extended.

item.title: Workforce shortages hit DHB's Mental Health and Addiction services
item.description: Workforce shortages remain an ongoing problem for Counties Manukau Health's Mental Health and Addiction division, according to a new DHB report.

item.title: One new confirmed case in managed isolation, four probable cases - Bloomfield
item.description: QR app codes are now mandatory for businesses and services, Jacinda Ardern and Ashley Bloomfield have revealed, as they announce new Covid-19 cases in New Zealand.

item.title: Air NZ boss hopes disruption will not be 'lengthy and difficult'
item.description: Air New Zealand can absorb a short-term disruption to flights but if it becomes a lengthy ordeal it will need to take another look at its finances, its chief executive says.

item.title: Auckland in alert level 3: preparing for the worst, hoping for the best
item.description: Aucklanders are upbeat about being able to make it through alert level 3 again, but businesses are not sure they will survive another lockdown.

item.title: Aucklanders queue for testing, rush to supermarkets
item.description: Checkpoint - Auckland has ground to a halt today as people rushed out to get supplies, Covid tests, and work gear, as the alert level 3 restrictions came into place.

item.title: Testing and tracing trump modelling - Hipkins
item.description: Testing and contact tracing are far more important than "academically interesting" modelling, Health Minister Chris Hipkins says.

item.title: One person in custody at Hamilton Covid-19 testing centre
item.description: One person has been taken into custody at a Hamilton testing centre.

item.title: Drone use rules in New Zealand not widely understood - CAA study
item.description: A quarter of recreational drone users don't know the rules around where or when they can fly their device.

item.title: Pregnant woman forced into parental leave takes case to Court of Appeal
item.description: A Taupō woman who was forced out of her job because she was pregnant has caught the attention of the Court of Appeal.

item.title: New Christchurch Hospital building: November opening 'bittersweet'
item.description: Christchurch Hospital's new Acute Services Building finally has an opening date of 16 November after two years of delays and going at least $80 million over budget.

item.title: Jail terms for Sanford crew members involved in pub violence
item.description: Three New Zealanders who pleaded guilty to violent disorder charges after attacking patrons at a pub on the Falkland Islands have been sentenced.

item.title: Major sewer blockage disrupts traffic in Gisborne
item.description: Fat and rags have almost completely blocked a Gisborne sewer - the city's second major blockage in just a few weeks.

item.title: Covid-19 travel restrictions: Masks on flights as measures take effect
item.description: People heading to Auckland Airport are being strongly urged to wear a mask in the terminal and on their flight.

item.title: Covid-19: Healthline inundated with calls since news of community cases
item.description: One caller says they phoned at 6am today and an hour and a half later, he was 487 in the queue and the wait time had grown to an hour.

item.title: New case of Covid-19 had travelled to Rotorua while symptomatic
item.description: Dr Ashley Bloomfield says one of the latest Covid-19 cases in the community - a woman in her 20s - had travelled to Rotorua over the weekend while she was symptomatic.
